YogAI

Downward Dog 

One of yoga's most widely recognized poses, Downward-Facing Dog Pose, called Adho Mukha Svanasana in Sanskrit, works to strengthen the core and improve circulation. This rejuvenating pose works to provide a delicious, full-body stretch.

Check Out

Tree Pose

Tree Pose, called Vrksasana in Sanskrit, establishes strength and balance in the legs, and helps you feel centered, steady, and grounded.

Check Out

Warrior 2

Warrior 2 Pose is a standing strength pose meant to energize the body and mind, increasing concentration and stamina. The posture strengthens the legs as it opens up the chest and hips.

Check Out

plank pose



Nurture your love-hate relationship with Plank Pose. A beginner's best friend, it's the perfect precursor to more challenging arm balances.

Check Out
